description: Frp, Latin alte (adverb) (from altus (“high”)) + loquens, p. pr. of loqui (“to speak”).

adjectives.description: altiloquent (comparative more altiloquent, superlative most altiloquent)

examples: [T]hey listened, dazzle-eyed- secretly making lists- to grandly romantic trash: bad poetry, stupid theology- altiloquent designs in the empty air.
